CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 3, reads: "Myers' is Scene of Last Rites for 'Ginger' - The funeral home of Henry A. Myers at 6542 Frankstown Avenue was the scene Monday of the last rites for Genevieve 'Ginger' Stewart, murder victim of her sweetheart, George Grogan, Jr. Hundreds of curious people milled on the outside of the Myers' establishment to get a glimpse of the casket bearing the remains of the glamorous Westinghouse high graduate.  At the time this photograph was taken, Grogan was re-enacting the crime for county detectives and District Attorney Park. - Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Men and women standing around parked hearse, for funeral of murder victim Genevieve "Ginger" Stewart, at Henry A. Myers funeral home, 6542 Frankstown Avenue, East Liberty
